alert.note: Alert for Perry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:59AM CDT until April 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BOLLINGER...SOUTH CENTRAL PERRY AND NORTHWESTERN CAPE GIRARDEAU COUNTIES... At 258 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alliance to Patton to 6 miles north of Marble Hill, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marble Hill, Patton, Alliance, Daisy, Millersville, Oak Ridge, Sedgewickville and Glenallen. This includes Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 116 and 126. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM CDT for southeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
